intro: Hibbertia proxima, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red centers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in regions of Western Australia. Hibbertia proxima has narrow, linear leaves and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. It is also valued for its ability to thrive in dry conditions.
